results.title: Crash zone. Vol. 2. Season 1. Eps 06-09
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Pino Amenta, Ray Boseley, Stephen Johnson, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Disney Channel Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crash zone”.
Episode 6: When Bec begins a ‘Net romance’ the boys are sceptical. Their worst fears are realised when they discover that it is Virgil, their A.I. friend that is wooing her. Episode 7: Bec and Pi have differences of opinion when they design a game for girls about teenage romance. The resulting mess causes the team to acknowledge they still have a lot to learn about emotions and life. Episode 8: When a reporter arrives at Catalyst to do a story on the testers, they have suspicions she may be a spy. Pi, who has led the gang to believe she is a street kid, is unmasked when her mother tracks her to the company. Cast includes Paul Pantano, Cassandra Magrath, Nikolai Nikolaeff, Frances Wang, Damien Bodie, Nicki Wendt and Matthew Parkinson. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv

results.title: Crash zone. Vol. 1. Season 1. Eps 01-05
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Pino Amenta, Ray Boseley, Stephen Johnson, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Disney Channel Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crash zone”.
Episode 1: Mike, Pi, Bec, Marcello and Ram all decipher a coded message on the net which leads them to Catalyst software where they are offered the job of their dreams - testing video games after school. Episode 2: While testing a video game the kids encounter Virgil, an artificial intelligence that lives inside the Internet, and uncover his origins. Episode 3: When Alex, the head of Catalyst, loses her necklace, the gang comes under suspicion. At the same time Marcello’s little sister is lost on the streets, giving the friends two cases to solve. Episode 4: Master inventor and the youngest of the group Ram, gets more than he bargained for when he sells one of his adventures to a strange girl. Episode 5: A computer virus invades Catalyst threatening the company’s computer systems. The team is tense after Mike fails to defend Bec when his friends make racist comments to her. Cast includes Paul Pantano, Cassandra Magrath, Nikolai Nikolaeff, Frances Wang, Damien Bodie, Nicki Wendt and Matthew Parkinson. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv

results.title: Crash Zone: Undercover
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Philip Dalkin
results.brief_description:
Alex’s valuable necklace goes missing at Catalyst and everyone is a suspect. Pi feels particularly that she needs to prove her innocence although Virgil’s idea of helping by downloading Detective Stories from the Net is making things more difficult. When Marcello’s little sister Sam is lost on the streets, the kids have two demanding cases on their hands.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: Truth Hurts
results.creator_credit: Ray Boseley, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Shane Brennan
results.brief_description:
Pi and Bec are asked by Alex to design a game to appeal to girls. The game, ‘Boyfriends’ is about the tribulations of teenage romance. The trouble is Bec and Pi have very different ideas about what it means to be a girl. The game is a mess and when Mike tries to use it to bring his separated parents closer, everyone realises they’ve got a lot to learn about emotions and life.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: The Shadow
results.creator_credit: Pino Amenta, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Anthony Morris
results.brief_description:
Marcello throws Catalyst into uproar when he hacks into Alex’s system. Alex brings in legendary hacker-tracker J.D. Moon to find the security breach. Marcello is too scared to own up to his foolishness and as J.D. Moon gets closer to the truth, the kids have to choose whether to help Marcello or not. When Alex discovers the truth, she fires Marcello.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pino Amenta, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children’s Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Anthony Morris
results.description:
Marcello throws Catalyst into uproar when he hacks into Alex’s system. Alex brings in legendary hacker-tracker J.D. Moon to find the security breach. Marcello is too scared to own up to his foolishness and as J.D. Moon gets closer to the truth, the kids have to choose whether to help Marcello or not. When Alex discovers the truth, she fires Marcello.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: The Outsider
results.creator_credit: Stephen Johnson, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Philip Dalkin
results.brief_description:
When Virgil goes missing after confiding in Ram, it’s obvious to the kids that Sunijim has somehow ‘captured’ him. Marcello sees this as a way to redeem himself in Alex’s eyes and, with his friends’ help, infiltrates Sunijim in an attempt to rescue Virgil from Brad Kane. When Marcello gets into difficulties, the team use all their computer skills to save Marcello and Virgil, reuniting the Crash Zone team.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Johnson, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children’s Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Philip Dalkin

results.title: Crash Zone: The Dream Team
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Philip Dalkin
results.brief_description:
A coded message on the Net becomes an irresistible puzzle for Mike, Pi, Bec, Marcello and Ram. Following the clues leads them to a meeting with Alexandra Davis, head of Software company Catalyst, and a job testing video games after school! The job of their dreams which brings unexpected surprises including the discovery of Virgil, a strange artificial intelligence loose on the Net.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: Secrets and Lies
results.creator_credit: Pino Amenta, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Philip Dalkin
results.brief_description:
Bec is intrigued and delighted by a ‘Net romance’ she’s pursuing. The boys are sceptical and their worst fears are realised when they find out it’s really Virgil writing love letters to Bec. Pi tries to think of a way to save Bec from the humiliation of finding out she’s romancing a program! How can she do this when her own lies are getting her deeper in trouble herself?
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: No News is Good News
results.creator_credit: Pino Amenta, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Kevin Nemeth
results.brief_description:
The kids are alone at Catalyst and having a great time when Kimberley arrives. She’s a news reporter, there to do a story on the testers. Mike is flattered but the other kids begin to suspect she’s a spy. Pi finally succeeds in getting rid of Kimberley only to find her own mother has tracked her to Catalyst. Pi’s unmasked. Now everybody knows she’s a rich kid.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: Leap of Faith
results.creator_credit: Pino Amenta, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel, Kevin Nemeth and Philip Dalkin
results.brief_description:
Leo Moore arrives at Catalyst with a game he’s invented and Alex is very keen to put money into it. Mike smells a rat, and not just because Leo seems to be attracted to Pi. When Mike realises Leo’s stolen the game, he teams up with Pi to save Alex from embarrassment. Brought closer together, Mike and Pi are drawn into a kiss that surprises them both.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.
